curam.util.administration.intf
Interface EventDefinitionAdmin

All Known Implementing Classes:
curam.util.administration.base.EventDefinitionAdmin
Direct Known Subclasses:
EventDefinitionAdminFactory
public abstract class EventDefinitionAdmin
extends curam.util.administration.base.EventDefinitionAdmin

EventDefinitionAdmin is the administration interface for Curam Event Maintenance. It provides the functions for adding, deleting, modifying and display event classes. It also provides the functions for adding, removing and modifying event types and also associating event types with their corresponding event classes.

Creates a new event class.

Parameters:
eventClassDetails - The details that will be used to create the new event class.
Throws:
AppException - ID_EVENT_CLASS_NOT_SPECIFIED - If the Event Class key has not been specified.
AppException - ID_CANNOT_ADD_EVENT_CLASS_ENTRY_ALREADY_EXISTS - if the Event Class has been inputted more than once. The event class specified must be unique.

createEventType

public void createEventType(EventTypeDetails eventType)
                     throws AppException,
                            DatabaseException,
                            InformationalException
Creates a new event type and associates this with an event class.

Parameters:
eventType - The Event Type to be created and the event class it is to be associated with.
Throws:
AppException - ID_EVENT_TYPE_NOT_SPECIFIED - If the Event Type key has not been specified.
AppException - ID_CANNOT_ADD_EVENT_TYPE_EVENT_CLASS_DOES_NOT_EXIST - The event type can be added to the specified event class if the event class does not exist.
AppException - ID_CANNOT_ADD_EVENT_TYPE_ENTRY_ALREADY_EXISTS - If the Event Type has been input more than once. The specified event type must be unique.
DatabaseException - Standard database exceptions.
InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.
